intro: Barroetea brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed barroetea, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically small and pale in color, often appearing in clusters. Barroetea brevipes is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or arid environments.
